replies.bodyText:
Okay, interesting. So for the update request, we encode the properties 2 different ways.
I found the utility which builds the mask in Node (https://github.com/firebase/firebase-admin-node/blob/0f6c02e3377c3337e4f206e176b2d96ec6dd6c3c/src/utils/index.ts#L148).
Any idea if we already have a similar utility in Java? Or do I need to write one? From looking at Node's tests (https://github.com/firebase/firebase-admin-node/blob/0f6c02e3377c3337e4f206e176b2d96ec6dd6c3c/test/unit/utils/index.spec.ts#L307), it looks like the format we want is something like this:
...../tenants/TENANT_ID?updateMask=name.TENANT_ID,displayName.DISPLAY_NAME,allowPasswordSignup.true,enableEmailLinkSignin.false
Does that look right?

timeline.bodyText:
This will break if the request contains any nested properties (we don't have any at the moment). If the request is shaped like {"foo": {"bar": 100}}, the update mask should look like ['foo.bar'].
Let's either implement a small util function to generate the correct update masks for all requests, or add a comment/TODO here to indicate the limitation with the current appraoch.
timeline.author: hiranya911
